intro: Gasteria vlaaktensis, commonly known as the Vlaakten's gasteria, is a species of succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped foliage composed of thick, fleshy leaves. The leaves are typically gray-green with white or yellow markings, and they are arranged in a compact, upright pattern. This plant is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its leaves to survive dry conditions. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, blooming in late spring or early summer.
